H0.text: Adding a variety of vitamins to the supplement is the next step the manufacturer should take before offering it to the general public, after a small clinical trial showed the supplement increased bone density by 15% in 8 out of 10 middle‑aged women.

H1.text: Testing the supplement on mice in the laboratory is the step the manufacturer should take next after a small clinical trial showed a 15% increase in bone density in 8 of 10 middle‑aged women.

H2.text: Develop packaging that is attractive to women is the next step the manufacturer should take before offering the new calcium supplement, which in a small clinical trial increased bone density by 15 % in 8 of 10 middle‑aged women.

H3.text: Testing the supplement on a larger sample of women should be the next step for the manufacturer, after a small clinical trial showed a 15 % increase in bone density in 8 of 10 middle‑aged women.

A4.text: Potential drugs, for example, first have to be discovered, purified, characterized, and tested in labs (in cell and animal studies) before ever undergoing clinical trials.

A5.text: Pilot experiments are conducted to gain insights for design of the clinical trial to follow.
